generations.originalPrompt: Metallica Master Of Puppets Rhythm Guitar Main Riff

proDescription.sound_description: Aggressive, tight, highly articulate, mid-scooped, palm-muted chug with lots of attack, saturated but not muddy, precise and powerful, with clear pick definition and minimal ambience.
proDescription.guitar_rig_description: Noise gate: used to keep the signal tight and eliminate unwanted noise between fast palm mutes. Compressor: not used. Overdrive/Distortion: a classic, mid-scooped high-gain distortion pedal (e.g., Tube Screamer set for boost, but with low drive) placed before the amp for added tightness. Amplifier: high-gain tube amp head (e.g., Mesa/Boogie Mark IIC+) with aggressive gain, scooped mids, and tight low end. Cabinet: 4x12 closed-back cabinet with Celestion speakers, miked for focused attack. EQ: graphic EQ in the amp’s loop or after preamp with a deep mid scoop, boosted lows and highs. Modulation: not used. Delay: not used. Reverb: not used.
proDescription.additional_info: Use downpicking technique for tightness and aggression; heavy gauge strings (e.g., 10-46 or higher) for stability; set guitar volume and tone controls to maximum for full output.

realRig.cabinet: Mesa/Boogie 4x12 Rectifier Standard Slant Cabinet with Celestion Vintage 30 speakers

versions.prompt: Metallica Master Of Puppets Rhythm Guitar Main Riff

proDescription.sound_description: Aggressive, tight, percussive, mid-heavy with pronounced attack, thick low end, and controlled high frequencies. Slightly scooped mids for clarity, but enough presence to cut through. High gain, minimal noise, dry and direct with little ambience.
proDescription.guitar_rig_description: 1. Noise Gate: Used to eliminate noise and keep palm-muted chugs tight and defined. 2. Compressor: Not used (the tightness comes from gating and picking technique). 3. Overdrive/Boost: Used before the amp, set as a clean boost to tighten the low end and push the amp harder. 4. Distortion: Not used separately; high-gain comes from the amp. 5. Amplifier: High-gain modern tube amp model, dialed for aggressive distortion with tight low end, biting mids, and controlled highs. 6. Cabinet: 4x12 cabinet with V30-style speakers for punch and clarity, mic’d close for directness. 7. EQ: Used post-amp to cut mud in the low-mids, slightly scoop mids, and tame harsh highs. 8. Modulation: Not used. 9. Delay: Not used. 10. Reverb: Not used; tone is dry and immediate.
proDescription.additional_info: Use tight palm muting and aggressive picking. Guitar tuned to Drop B. Medium to heavy gauge strings for tension. EMG 81/85 or similar active pickups preferred for clarity and punch.

realRig.cabinet: Mesa/Boogie Rectifier Standard 4x12 with Celestion Vintage 30

generations.originalPrompt: Sorry You're Not A Winner Intro Rory

proDescription.tone_title: Sorry You're Not A Winner - Intro (Rory Clewlow)
proDescription.sound_description: Very percussive, tight, mid-gain distortion with pronounced attack and clarity. Dry, staccato, and articulate for rapid palm-muted rhythms. Bright top-end for cutting through the mix, but with enough body for fullness.
proDescription.guitar_rig_description: Noise gate: used to keep the rapid, staccato rhythm ultra-tight and eliminate string noise. Compressor: not used, as dynamics are primarily controlled by playing technique. Overdrive/distortion/boost: mid-gain distortion pedal (or amp gain), providing clarity, tightness, and aggression without excessive saturation. Amplifier: high-headroom, modern-sounding amp with fast transient response, set for a tight, punchy clean or edge-of-breakup character. Cabinet: 4x12 closed-back cab with modern speakers for focused lows and bright highs. EQ: used post-distortion or in amp’s tone stack to emphasize upper mids and cut muddiness, with a slight high-end boost for articulation. Modulation: not used. Delay: not used. Reverb: not used for this part, keeping the sound dry and immediate.
references: Enter Shikari – Sorry You're Not A Winner (studio and live)
The Dillinger Escape Plan – Panasonic Youth
At The Drive-In – One Armed Scissor (intro tones)
proDescription.additional_info: Use a hard pick and aggressive palm-muting for definition. Medium gauge (10-46 or higher) strings. Rory often uses a Fender Telecaster with a humbucker in the bridge position. Keep effects and ambience minimal for precision.

realRig.cabinet: Mesa/Boogie Rectifier Standard 4x12 with Celestion Vintage 30 speakers

proDescription.sound_description: Aggressive, high-gain, tight low end, percussive attack, moderately scooped mids, bright but controlled highs, clear note separation, substantial sustain, minimal noise.

Overdrive/Boost: A transparent overdrive placed before the amp to tighten the low end and push the amp harder, increasing clarity and attack. 4. Cabinet: 4x12 cabinet with V30-style speakers, miked close for punch and clarity. 6. EQ: Post-amp sculpting to trim muddy low-mids, slightly scoop the mids, and tame any harsh highs. 7. Modulation: Not used. 8. Delay: Not used. 9. Reverb: Not used, for maximum punch and dryness.
references: Bullet For My Valentine - Waking the Demon
Trivium - Pull Harder on the Strings of Your Martyr
proDescription.additional_info: Use palm muting with precise right-hand technique, heavy gauge strings (11-52 or similar) for tightness, guitar tuned to Drop C. Pick attack should be aggressive and controlled for clarity.

generations.originalPrompt: Sonne Rammstein Rhythm Guitar Whole song

proDescription.sound_description: Heavy, tight, percussive, and aggressive with a thick midrange, pronounced low end, and a slight high-end bite. The tone is focused and modern, cutting through the mix but not overly bright. Palm-muted chugs are punchy and articulate, with minimal noise and maximum clarity.
proDescription.guitar_rig_description: Noise gate: Used at the start of the chain to tightly control amp hiss and palm-mute clarity. Compressor: Not used. Overdrive/Distortion: A modern, high-gain distortion pedal or boost pedal in front of the amp to tighten the attack and increase saturation. Amplifier: High-gain German-style amp head, dialed for aggressive distortion and tight low end. Cabinet: 4x12 closed-back cabinet with modern voicing, miked with a dynamic microphone. EQ: Graphic EQ in the amp’s effects loop to further sculpt the mids and tighten the lows, gently rolling off some highs for smoothness. Modulation: Not used. Delay: Not used. Reverb: Not used.
proDescription.additional_info: Use tight palm-muting and down-picking technique for percussive sound. Heavy gauge strings (at least .011–.052) recommended for tuning stability and punch. Drop tuning (Drop D or Drop C#) is commonly used. Active pickups (like EMG 81) are preferred for clarity and output, but high-output passives are also workable.

pedalboard: Boss GE-7 Equalizer (in amp FX loop)
realRig.cabinet: Mesa/Boogie Rectifier Standard 4x12 with Celestion Vintage 30 speakers

versions.prompt: Sonne Rammstein Rhythm Guitar Whole song

proDescription.sound_description: The tone is heavy, tight, and percussive with pronounced low end, aggressive midrange, and a slight top-end sizzle. It is very focused and dry, with minimal ambience, excellent note separation, and a mechanical, disciplined attack. The sound is high-gain but not overly saturated—retaining clarity during palm-muted riffs.
proDescription.guitar_rig_description: Noise gate: used to keep the signal tight and silent between heavy palm-muted chugs. Compressor: not used, as the amp and heavy picking provide sufficient compression. Overdrive: used as a boost before the amp to tighten the low end and add definition, set with low drive and high level. Amplifier: high-gain German-voiced amp head (e.g., ENGL or Mesa Boogie Dual Rectifier), providing the core distortion and aggressive character. Cabinet: 4x12 cabinet with V30-style speakers, delivering punchy lows and clear highs. EQ: used post-amp to scoop some mids slightly and cut out unwanted low and high frequencies, emphasizing the characteristic industrial sound. Modulation: not used, as the tone is very dry and direct. Delay: not used. Reverb: not used, keeping the sound extremely tight and in-your-face.
proDescription.song_part: whole song (all rhythm and lead parts)
proDescription.additional_info: Use a guitar with high-output active or passive humbuckers (ESP/LTD models common for Rammstein), heavy gauge strings for tightness, and aggressive palm muting. Down-tuned to Drop D or Drop C# depending on the live setting. Pick attack should be strong and consistent for the industrial metal chug.

realRig.cabinet: Mesa/Boogie Rectifier Standard 4x12 with Celestion Vintage 30

generations.originalPrompt: Ac dc back in black Intro

proDescription.sound_description: Punchy, mid-focused crunch with plenty of attack, tight low end, smooth but present highs, and a dynamic, open feel. The tone is raw and uncompressed, allowing the natural bite and clarity of the guitar to shine through.
proDescription.guitar_rig_description: Noise gate: not used (signal is clean and controlled; noise is not an issue). Compressor: not used (dynamic playing is preserved for a natural feel). Overdrive/Boost: light overdrive or boost pedal (optional, used to push the amp slightly for extra bite and sustain). Amplifier: classic British-style tube amp set to edge-of-breakup/crunch (e.g., Marshall Plexi or JCM800), providing the main character of the tone. Cabinet: 4x12 closed-back cabinet with vintage-style speakers (e.g., Celestion Greenbacks), contributing to the punchy and focused sound. EQ: amp and/or pedal EQ set for a pronounced midrange, tight bass, and clear but not harsh treble. Modulation: not used (tone remains dry and direct). Delay: not used. Reverb: subtle spring reverb (optional, just to add a touch of space without washing out the dry attack).
proDescription.additional_info: Use a solid-body guitar (e.g., Gibson SG or Les Paul), bridge pickup engaged, and play with strong, percussive right-hand attack. Medium gauge strings (e.g., 10-46) recommended for punch and sustain. Avoid excessive gain; the tone should be crunchy but articulate, letting chords ring clearly.

pedalboard: MXR M133 Micro Amp (set Level at 11–12 o’clock for subtle boost; optional, only if extra bite is needed)
Reverb: Add via amp’s onboard spring reverb or use Boss RV-6 (set to Spring, Level at 8–9 o’clock, Tone at 10 o’clock, minimal Decay)
realRig.cabinet: Marshall 1960AX 4x12 with Celestion G12M Greenback speakers

versions.prompt: Ac dc back in black Intro

proDescription.sound_description: Clean, slightly compressed tone with chime and clarity, mild warmth, not overly bright, rich in dynamics, slight touch of ambience for spatial depth.
proDescription.guitar_rig_description: Noise gate: not used (signal is clean and dynamics are important). Compressor: used for subtle dynamic leveling and slight sustain, keeping attack natural. Overdrive/distortion/boost: not used (clean tone). Amplifier: clean channel of a Fender-style tube amp for bright, glassy cleans with a bit of warmth. Cabinet: 2x12 open-back cabinet to enhance airy high-end and chime. EQ: applied for mild mid-scoop and to roll off harsh highs. Modulation: not used. Delay: not used. Reverb: used moderately for a touch of room ambience, giving space without washing out the tone.
references: Red Hot Chili Peppers - Scar Tissue
John Frusciante - Live at Slane Castle (Scar Tissue intro)
proDescription.additional_info: Strat-style guitar with single-coil pickups is preferred. Light to medium string gauge (e.g., .010-.046). Play with fingers or pick for soft attack. Let notes ring and use slides for phrasing, mimicking John Frusciante's touch.

realRig.cabinet: Fender 212 Enclosure with 2x12" Jensen C12K speakers (open-back)

proDescription.sound_description: Tight, aggressive, and percussive high-gain rhythm guitar tone with pronounced low end, focused mids, and controlled high frequencies. The tone is very dry with minimal ambience, featuring a fast attack and palm-muted chug, while remaining clear and articulate under heavy distortion.
proDescription.guitar_rig_description: 1. Noise Gate: Used at the front of the chain to eliminate unwanted string and amplifier noise, ensuring tight stops and starts. 2. Compressor: Not used, as dynamics should remain natural and punchy. 3. Overdrive/Distortion: A high-gain distortion pedal or amp's lead channel used to provide saturated metal rhythm crunch, with clarity and minimal muddiness. 4. Amplifier: Modern high-gain tube amp model, tight bass response, focused mids, and controlled treble for aggressive rhythm playing. 5. Cabinet: 4x12 closed-back cabinet with V30-style speakers, mic'd close for tightness and punch. 6. EQ: Used post-amp to slightly cut low-mids and high frequencies, and to tighten up the low end. 7. Modulation: Not used, as the tone is kept dry and direct. 8. Delay: Not used, to preserve the dry and immediate character. 9. Reverb: Not used, as the recording and live tone are both very dry and focused.
proDescription.additional_info: Use a guitar with active pickups (such as EMG 81) or high-output passives for tightness and clarity. Use heavy gauge strings for increased tension and attack. Play with strong palm muting to accentuate the percussive character. Down-tuned to Drop D or Drop C# depending on live arrangement.

realRig.cabinet: Mesa/Boogie Rectifier Standard 4x12 with Celestion Vintage 30 speakers

generations.originalPrompt: As I Lay Dying Throught Striggle Main Riff

proDescription.tone_title: As I Lay Dying - Through Struggle Main Riff
proDescription.sound_description: Tight, aggressive, and modern high-gain tone with pronounced attack, solid low end, scooped mids, and a bright top end. The sound is highly articulate for fast palm-muted riffs, with controlled noise and a percussive punch.
proDescription.guitar_rig_description: 1. Noise gate: Used to keep the high-gain signal tight and eliminate unwanted feedback or string noise between chugs. 2. Compressor: Not used, as the high-gain amp provides natural compression. 3. Overdrive/boost: Placed before the amp, typically a classic overdrive pedal with low drive and high level to tighten the low end and add clarity to pick attack. 4. Amplifier: Modern high-gain tube amp (e.g., Peavey 5150/6505 or Mesa/Boogie Dual Rectifier) set for aggressive distortion, tight bass, and crisp highs. 5. Cabinet: 4x12 closed-back cab with high-power speakers (e.g., Celestion V30s) for punch and definition. 6. EQ: Graphic EQ in the effects loop or post-amp to further sculpt a scooped midrange and refine bass/tremble response. 7. Modulation: Not used. 8. Delay: Not used. 9. Reverb: Not used.
references: As I Lay Dying - Through Struggle
proDescription.additional_info: Pick attack and palm-muting are crucial for articulation. Use medium to heavy gauge strings for tightness (e.g., 10-52 or 11-54), and tune down to Drop C as per the original recording. Use a pick with a sharp tip for clarity.

realRig.cabinet: Mesa/Boogie Rectifier Standard 4x12 with Celestion Vintage 30 speakers
